chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall (T : Type) (H : Lift T) (V : Type) (H0 : Subst V T), LiftLift -> SubstLift -> forall (k : nat) (t : T), closed k t -> forall j : nat, j >= k -> forall v : V, subst v j t = t

Premises:

Record LiftLift (T : Type) (H : Lift T) : Prop := Build_LiftLift { lift_lift : forall (t : T) (k s wk ws : nat), k <= s -> lift wk k (lift ws s t) = lift ws (wk + s) (lift wk k t) } Arguments LiftLift {T}%type_scope {H} Arguments Build_LiftLift [T]%type_scope _ _%function_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope

closed_lift_invariant : forall k t : nat, closed k t -> forall j : nat, j >= k -> forall w : nat, lift w j t = t

Build_LiftSubst : forall (V : Type) (H : Lift V) (T : Type) (H0 : Lift T) (H1 : Subst V T), (forall (t : T) (k : nat) (v : V) (s w : nat), lift w k (subst v s t) = subst (lift w k v) (lift w (1 + k) s) (lift w (shift s k) t)) -> LiftSubst

Record Rotate1SelfInverse (V : Type) (H : Var V) (T : Type) (H0 : Lift T) (H1 : Subst V T) : Prop := Build_Rotate1SelfInverse { rotate1_self_inverse : forall t : T, rotate 1 (rotate 1 t) = t } Arguments Rotate1SelfInverse {V}%type_scope {H} {T}%type_scope {H0 H1} Arguments Build_Rotate1SelfInverse [V]%type_scope _ [T]%type_scope _ _ _%function_scope

```coq
intros T H V H0 LiftLift SubstLift k t Hclosed j Hgeq v.
induction j.
- assert (k = 0) by omega. subst. destruct (closed 0 t) as [Heq|Hlt]; eauto.
  rewrite Heq. apply subst_lift.
- destruct (le_gt_dec k j).
  + apply closed_monotonic with (k := k) in Hclosed; eauto.
    destruct (closed j t) as [Heq|Hlt]; eauto.
    rewrite Heq. apply subst_lift.
  + inversion Hgeq.
Qed.
```

original: intros T H V H0 LiftLift SubstLift k t Hclosed j Hgeq v. induction j. - assert (k = 0) by omega. subst. destruct (closed 0 t) as [Heq|Hlt]; eauto. rewrite Heq. apply subst_lift. - destruct (le_gt_dec k j). + apply closed_monotonic with (k := k) in Hclosed; eauto. destruct (closed j t) as [Heq|Hlt]; eauto. rewrite Heq. apply subst_lift. + inversion Hgeq.
